form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Received; read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to notify Congress of conferences sponsored by the Department of Veterans Affairs, and for other purposes.

section.header: Quarterly reports to Congress on conferences sponsored by the Department

subsection.text: Subchapter I of chapter 5 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Quarterly reports to Congress on conferences sponsored by the Department

subsection.text: Not later than 30 days after the end of each fiscal quarter, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the Senate a report on covered conferences.
Each report under subsection (a) shall include the following:

paragraph.text: An accounting of the final costs to the Department of each covered conference occurring during the fiscal quarter preceding the date on which the report is submitted, including the costs related to—

subparagraph.text: rental of halls, auditoriums, or other spaces;

paragraph.text: The total estimated costs to the Department for covered conferences occurring during the fiscal quarter in which the report is submitted.

subsection.text: In this section, the term covered conference means a conference, meeting, or other similar forum that is sponsored or co-sponsored by the Department of Veterans Affairs and is—

paragraph.text: attended by 50 or more individuals, including one or more employees of the Department; or
estimated to cost the Department at least $20,000.

subsection.text: The table of sections at the beginning of such chapter is amended by adding after the item relating to section 516 the following:

toc.toc-entry: 517. Quarterly reports to Congress on conferences sponsored by the Department.

section.header: Submission of certain information by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs

subsection.text: Subchapter II of chapter 5 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 529 the following new section:

section.header: Submission of certain information by the Secretary to Congress

subsection.text: The submission of information by the Secretary to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the House of Representatives or the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the Senate in response to a request for such information made by a covered member of the committee shall be deemed to be—

paragraph.text: a permitted disclosure under regulations promulgated under section 264(c) of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (Public Law 104–191), including a permitted disclosure for oversight activities authorized by law as described in section 164.512(d) of title 45, Code of Federal Regulations.

subsection.text: With respect to a request for information described in subsection (a) made by a covered member of the committee who is not the chairman, the Secretary shall also submit such information to the chairman of the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the House of Representatives or the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the Senate, as the case may be.
In this section, the term covered member of the committee means the following:

paragraph.text: The chairman or ranking member of the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the House of Representatives or the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the Senate.
A chairman or ranking member of a subcommittee of the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the House of Representatives or the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs of the Senate.
The designee of a chairman or ranking member described in paragraph (1) or (2).

subsection.text: The table of sections at the beginning of such chapter is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 529 the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 529A. Submission of certain information by the Secretary to Congress.

section.header: Publication of data on employment of certain veterans by Federal contractors
section.text: Section 4212(d) of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: The Secretary of Labor shall establish and maintain an Internet website on which the Secretary shall publicly disclose the information reported to the Secretary of Labor by contractors under paragraph (1).

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives October 11, 2011.
